1{-# LANGUAGE ViewPatterns #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Text utility.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Text.Utility
7  ( -- * Reexport from Data.Char
8    Ch.isSpace,
9
10    -- * Trim
11    trimBegin, trimEnd, trimBoth,
12    sweep, sweepAll,
13
14    -- * Padding
15    padBegin, padEnd, 
16    padBeginWith, padEndWith,
17    stringWidth,
18    addSpace,
19
20    -- * Code point
21    isAsciiCode,
22    isControlCode,
23    isFormatCode,
24    isNewlineCode,
25    integralHT,
26    integralLF,
27    integralVT,
28    integralFF,
29    integralCR,
30    integralSpace,
31
32    -- * Put
33    putLn, hPutLn,
34    putShow, putShowLn,
35    putLines, hPutLines, 
36    prompt, promptWith,
37  ) where
38
39import qualified Data.Char                              as Ch
40import qualified System.IO                              as IO
41import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Type          as O
42import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Text.Textual  as O
43
44
45-- ============================================  Trim
46
47-- | Remove space and space-like characters from the beginning of string.
48--
49--   >>> trimBegin "  abc  "
50--   "abc  "
51--
52trimBegin :: (O.Textual t) => t -> t
53trimBegin = tDropWhile Ch.isSpace
54
55tDropWhile :: (O.Textual t) => O.Test Char -> t -> t
56tDropWhile f = loop where
57    loop (O.tCut -> Just (c, t)) | f c  = loop t
58    loop t = t
59
60-- | Remove space and space-like characters from the end of string.
61--
62--   >>> trimEnd "  abc  "
63--   "  abc"
64--
65trimEnd :: (O.Textual t) => t -> t
66trimEnd (O.tCut -> Just (x, xs)) =
67    let ys = x O.<:> trimEnd xs
68    in case O.tCut2 ys of
69         Just (y, Nothing) | Ch.isSpace y -> O.tEmpty
70         _ -> ys
71trimEnd t = t
72
73-- | Remove space and space-like characters
74--   from the beginning and end of string.
75--
76--   >>> trimBoth "  abc  "
77--   "abc"
78--
79trimBoth :: (O.Textual t) => t -> t
80trimBoth = trimEnd . trimBegin
81
82-- | Trim and shorten consecutive spaces.
83--
84--   >>> sweep "  foo  bar   baz "
85--   "foo bar baz"
86--
87sweep :: (O.Textual t) => t -> t
88sweep = loop . trimBegin where
89    loop (O.tCut -> Just(c, t))
90        | Ch.isSpace c  = case loop $ trimBegin t of
91                            t' | O.tIsEmpty t' -> O.tEmpty
92                               | otherwise     -> ' ' O.<:> t'
93        | otherwise     = c O.<:> loop t
94    loop t = t
95
96-- | Delete space characters.
97--
98--   >>> sweepAll "  foo  bar   baz "
99--   "foobarbaz"
100--
101sweepAll :: (O.Textual t) => t -> t
102sweepAll (O.tCut -> Just (c, t))
103    | Ch.isSpace c  = sweepAll t
104    | otherwise     = c O.<:> sweepAll t
105sweepAll t = t
106
107
108-- ============================================  Padding
109
110-- | Add spaces to the left.
111--
112--   >>> padBegin 10 "abc"
113--   "       abc"
114--
115padBegin :: Int -> O.StringMap
116padBegin = padBeginWith ' '
117
118-- | Add spaces to the right.
119--
120--   >>> padEnd 10 "abc"
121--   "abc       "
122--
123padEnd :: Int -> O.StringMap
124padEnd = padEndWith ' '
125
126-- | Add given character to the left.
127--
128--   >>> padBeginWith '.' 10 "abc"
129--   ".......abc"
130--
131padBeginWith :: Char -> Int -> O.StringMap
132padBeginWith p n s = replicate rest p ++ s where
133    rest = max 0 (n - stringWidth s)
134
135-- | Add given character to the right.
136padEndWith :: Char -> Int -> O.StringMap
137padEndWith p n s = s ++ replicate rest p where
138    rest = max 0 (n - stringWidth s)
139
140-- | Calculate width of string.
141stringWidth :: String -> Int
142stringWidth = sum . map charWidth
143
144-- | Character width.
145charWidth :: Char -> Int
146charWidth c
147    | Ch.ord c >= 256  = 2
148    | otherwise        = 1
149
150-- | Add space character if first character is non-space.
151--
152--   >>> addSpace "aaa"
153--   " aaa"
154--
155--   >>> addSpace " bbb"
156--   " bbb"
157--
158--   >>> addSpace ""
159--   ""
160--
161addSpace :: (O.Textual t) => t -> t
162addSpace cs@(O.tCut -> Just (c, _))
163    | Ch.isSpace c   = cs
164    | otherwise      = ' ' O.<:> cs
165addSpace _           = O.tEmpty
166
167
168-- ============================================  Code point
169
170-- | Test ASCII code point (0 .. 127).
171isAsciiCode :: (Integral n) => n -> Bool
172isAsciiCode = (<= 127)
173
174-- | Test ASCII control code point (0 .. 31, 127).
175isControlCode :: (Integral n) => n -> Bool
176isControlCode n = n <= 31 || n == 127
177
178-- | Test format code point (9 .. 13).
179isFormatCode :: (Integral n) => n -> Bool
180isFormatCode n = n >= integralHT && n <= integralCR
181
182-- | Test newline code point (10, 13).
183isNewlineCode :: (Integral n) => n -> Bool
184isNewlineCode n = (n == integralLF) || (n == integralCR)
185
186-- | Generic code point (9) of horizontal tab character (@'\t'@).
187integralHT :: (Integral n) => n
188integralHT = 9
189
190-- | Generic code point (10) of line feed character (@'\n'@).
191integralLF :: (Integral n) => n
192integralLF = 10
193
194-- | Generic code point (11) of vertical tab character (@'\v'@).
195integralVT :: (Integral n) => n
196integralVT = 11
197
198-- | Generic code point (12) of form feed character (@'\f'@).
199integralFF :: (Integral n) => n
200integralFF = 12
201
202-- | Generic code point (13) of carriage return character (@'\r'@).
203integralCR :: (Integral n) => n
204integralCR = 13
205
206-- | Generic code point (32) of space character (@' '@).
207integralSpace :: (Integral n) => n
208integralSpace = 32
209
210
211-- ============================================  Put
212
213-- | Print newline.
214putLn :: IO ()
215putLn = putStrLn ""
216
217-- | Print newline.
218hPutLn :: IO.Handle -> IO ()
219hPutLn h = IO.hPutStrLn h ""
220
221-- | Print showing value.
222putShow :: (Show a) => a -> IO ()
223putShow = putStr . show
224
225-- | Print showing value with newline.
226putShowLn :: (Show a) => a -> IO ()
227putShowLn = putStrLn . show
228
229-- | Print multiple lines.
230putLines :: [String] -> IO ()
231putLines = putStr . unlines
232
233-- | Print multiple lines.
234hPutLines :: IO.Handle -> [String] -> IO ()
235hPutLines h = (IO.hPutStrLn h `mapM_`)
236
237-- | Print prompt (@>>@) and read user input.
238--   It returns trimmed input string.
239--   Reread when input is empty.
240prompt :: IO String
241prompt = promptWith ">> "
242
243-- | Print prompt with give string and read user input.
244promptWith :: String -> IO String
245promptWith p =
246    do putStr p
247       IO.hFlush IO.stdout
248       s <- getLine
249       case trimBoth s of
250         "" -> promptWith p
251         s' -> return s'
